W. G. HUGHES,
Morganfield.
F. H. DALLAM,
Henderson.
D. H. HUGHES
Morganfield.
HUGHES, DALLAM & HUGHES,
COUNSELORS AND ATTORNEYS AT LAW,
MORGANFIELD AND HENDERSON, KY.
Will attend Promptly to all Business committed to them.

Morganfield, Ky., Nov 11th 1861.
To his Excellency Beriah Magoffin Governor of Ky
Dr Sir

You will remember my statement to you in the latter part of September in Frankfort of the case of young Berry confessing judgement for $150 on an indictment for carrying a challenge and your promise that it should be remitted. Mr Lowe our commonwealth's atty wrote you a letter last spring defining the circumstances with his opinion & request that the same should be remitted.
I send you a copy of the judgement and hope you will give it your immediate attention, the Sherriff having the "capias pro fine" in his hands=

Very Resp'y. Yr. Ob't. Serv't,
D, H, Hughes

Union Cir. Ct
$150. } Carrying Challenge
N. C. Berry
Issd Nov 19. 1861
